title: Out Can Be In – Online Seminar on Autism Inclusion
participants: Artists, educators, medical professionals, and project participants
description: An online seminar focused on the inclusion of people with autism in everyday life, with a special emphasis on art as a tool for inclusion.
fullDescription:
As part of the Erasmus+ project “Out Can Be In,” an online seminar was successfully held as a preparatory activity for the upcoming international mobilities. The seminar focused on the theme “Inclusion of People with Autism in Everyday Life,” highlighting practical and creative approaches to inclusion through art.

During the seminar, speakers discussed how artistic practices can support communication, self-expression, and social participation of people with autism. The session encouraged dialogue between different professional perspectives, combining artistic, medical, and educational viewpoints.

The seminar started at 13:00 and gathered participants interested in inclusive practices, awareness-raising, and preparation for future project activities. Several visual materials from the seminar were documented, capturing the interactive and informative atmosphere of the event.

This online activity played an important role in building a shared understanding among participants and setting the conceptual foundation for the forthcoming physical mobilities within the project.
objectives: To raise awareness about autism inclusion in everyday life
To explore art as a tool for social inclusion and communication
To prepare participants conceptually for upcoming project mobilities
results: Successful delivery of an online seminar with active participation
Enhanced understanding of inclusive practices related to autism
Strengthened interdisciplinary collaboration among moderators and participants
